main event: Ground observation of unusual vapor trails in Cheyenne, Wyoming on July 16, 1957
interesting points: The vapor trails developed a very faint and narrow trail, then progressively widened over the course of around 12 seconds, before disappearing within 5 minutes.
The vapor trails formed a 180-degree turn and were described as unusual in their pattern development.
A second vapor trail developed, moving from west to east in a straight line.
No plane or object was visible ahead of the vapor trails.
The observation occurred near the zenith, with scattered broken clouds at 8000 and 15000 feet.
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
